parameters: \N<Segi>...I'm concerned about Irime-san. Let's go check on her.

<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■EV発生■>
\N<Segi>Rozaro-san... good afternoon.
\N<Rozaro>Hey there, Segi-san.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Rozaro>...Feeling anxious? Is it about your next opponent by any
chance?

\N<Segi>...Yes, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't anxious. In the last
fight, Mr. Hojiko was just an ordinary man living in town,
like me.

\N<Segi>There might have been a difference between men and women,
but even so, I believe we were on the same terms in that
sense.

\N<Segi>However... my next opponent is different. He has combat
skills that even Luda acknowledges.

\N<Segi>Some even say he's a candidate for the champion of this
training session, alongside you, Rozaro-san...

\N<Segi>Facing such an opponent... when I think about it, I can't
help but feel a little anxious.

\N<Rozaro>Hmm... Indeed, as you say, Fubii could be called a genius.
Even I at his age wouldn't have come close to his level.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Rozaro>However... he's young. He has the ability, but he lacks
experience due to his youth.

\N<Rozaro>He may consider that to be his strength, but conversely,
that might be exactly where you can find an opening to
exploit.

\N<Segi>A weakness due to the lack of experience of youth... is that
what you mean?

\N<Rozaro>Yes, although what that weakness is... even I don't know at
this point.
B

\N<Rozaro>Hmm... Indeed, as you say, Fubii could be called a genius.
Even I, at the same age, might not have held a candle to
him.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Rozaro>However... he's young. He has the ability, but lacks
experience due to his youth.

\N<Rozaro>He may consider that to be his strength, but conversely,
that might be exactly where you can find an opening to
exploit.

\N<Segi>You mean the weakness that comes with the inexperience of
youth...

\N<Rozaro>Yes, although what that might be... even I don't know at
this point.
<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■EV発生■>
\N<Rozaro>Miss Segi, may I have a moment?
\N<Segi>Yes, do you need something...?

\N<Rozaro>No, it's about the other day's conversation. It's regarding
Fubii's weakness, the next opponent you're facing...
\N<Segi>...?

\N<Rozaro>To put it simply, I still don't know what it is. However,
I've had an idea. If we could talk to someone who knows his
past, perhaps we might find something.
\N<Segi>Someone who knows his past...?

\N<Rozaro>Yes, I apologize for the vague details. But that might be
the only way to learn anything about him. I wonder if
bringing this up has only confused you more?

\N<Segi>No, not at all. Thank you very much for the valuable
information.
DW_目標設定 Explore_Fubii's_past
C

\N<Rozaro>No, it's about the other day's conversation. It's regarding
the weakness of your next partner, Fubii...
\N<Segi>...?

\N<Rozaro>To put it bluntly, I still don't know what it is. However,
I've had a thought. If we could speak to someone who knows
his past, perhaps we might find something.
\N<Segi>Someone who knows his past...?

\N<Rozaro>Yes, I apologize for the opaque nature of this matter. But
that seems to be the only way to learn about him. I wonder
if this conversation has only served to confuse you more?

\N<Segi>No, not at all. Thank you for sharing such valuable
information.

\N<Man>If you don't need anything, please don't talk to me.
Drinking here is the only way I can forget this harsh
reality...

\N<Man>The residents have started fighting each other at the
training sessions, and everyone's becoming more
aggressive... Perhaps it's part of Luda's group's aim.

\N<Man>These days, even the soldiers of Luda are showing their
faces around here. I just want to drink my booze in peace...

\N<Man>I don't have the strength to win matches, nor do I have the
power to train myself against monsters in the ruins. Is it
my fate to just die like this...

\N<Man>It's embarrassing to admit, but my wife and I have grown
apart emotionally, and we no longer function as a couple.

\N<Man>And yet, why must I risk my life for her by participating in
the training soldiers' tournament...
<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■EV発生■>

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Oh, if it isn't Segi, the one who lost to my husband. What
do you need? As you can see, my husband isn't here, is he?
\N<Segi>I, I am...

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Hehe, relax. I haven't told anyone that you're participating
in that military training meeting. We're both women, after
all; I'm not that cruel.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>But you know... depending on your attitude from now on, my
feelings might change. You'd better be careful, hehe.
A
<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■EV発生■>

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Oh, if it isn't Segi, the one who beat up my husband. What
do you need? As you can see, my husband isn't here, right?
\N<Segi>I, I am...

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Hehe, relax. I haven't told anyone that you're participating
in that military training meeting. We're both women, after
all; I'm not that cruel.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>But you know... depending on your attitude from now on, my

A

\N<Hojiko's Wife>Hehe, don't worry. I haven't told anyone about your
participation in that training session. We're both women,
after all; I'm not that cruel.

\N<Hojiko's Wife>But you know... depending on how you behave from now on, my
feelings might change. You'd better be careful, hehe.

\N<Shopkeeper>Whether they're from Luda or not, a customer is a customer.
As long as I get paid, I'll provide the proper hospitality
here.

\N<Shopkeeper>There's no point in being stubborn about it, after all, I've
got to make a living too.
<ActiveMessage:\C[10]■EV発生■>
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>What's the matter, standing there like that? If you've come
here, does that mean you've come to work?

\N<Shopkeeper>I was hoping you'd come. It might have been a series of
misfortunes for you, madam, but I've made sure to provide a
fair compensation for it.

\N<Segi>I... did not intend to sell my heart along with my labor for
a reward.

\N<Shopkeeper>I understand, you and our shop are in the same boat, so to
speak. That's why I want to help you out for your sake.

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. Are you convinced? As usual, I've
prepared a change of clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on
you, okay?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>What's the matter, standing there like that? If you've come
here, does that mean you've come to work?
\N<Segi>But...

\N<Shopkeeper>Ah, are you talking about last time? Well, in this kind of
business, various things can happen at a drinking party.

\N<Shopkeeper>But still, you came here despite that. Isn't that the
answer? It's none other than yourself who needs to earn
money here, right?
\N<Segi>That is...

\N<Shopkeeper>I said I wouldn't get involved in your personal
circumstances. Of course, serving here isn't something I'd
force on you.

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. Are you convinced? As usual, I've
prepared a change of clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on
you, okay?
\N<Segi>...
\N<Shopkeeper>Hey, glad you came, madam. I was hoping you'd come again.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Heh, you won't attract customers with such a gloomy face.
You need to be brighter if you're going to be out in front
of people, right?

\N<Shopkeeper>Of course, I won't get involved in your personal
circumstances. I have no intention of sticking my nose into
unnecessary matters. Our relationship is strictly business.

\N<Shopkeeper>Heh, feeling relieved? As usual, I've prepared a change of
clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on you, okay?
\N<Segi>Um...

\N<Shopkeeper>Glad you came again, madam. Just between us, I actually
thought you would come.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Ah, rest assured. I'm not interested in your personal
circumstances.

\N<Shopkeeper>The issue is that you can attract customers. And I can
compensate you for that. That's what's important.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Shall we move on to the job at hand? Though this time
there's no need for you to go gathering materials. What I
need from you is just your service. Of course, the reward
will be generous.

\N<Segi>Wait, please. I haven't yet said that I would take the
job...
\N<Shopkeeper>...Is that so?
\N<Segi>...Yes.
\N<Shopkeeper>Hahaha, let's forget about the troublesome stuff for now.

\N<Shopkeeper>As I said before, I can compensate for your work. And in the
form that you desire most... right?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. As usual, I've prepared a change of
clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on you, okay?
\N<Segi>Um...
\N<Shopkeeper>Hm? What is it, madam?

\N<Segi>That is... I saw the request board. If it's alright with
you, I thought maybe I could be of some help...
\N<Shopkeeper>The request board? You're going to take on a request?
\N<Segi>Yes, if it's alright with you, I would like to help.

\N<Shopkeeper>That would be a great help. If it's you, madam, it's just
what I wished for.
\N<Segi>...?
\N<Shopkeeper>Then, let me explain the details of the request right away.
\N<Segi>Yes, please do.

\N<Shopkeeper>Although it's a simple matter. What I want to ask of you,
madam, is some help with customer service.

\N<Segi>Assistance with customer service... Understood. So what
should I do...?

\N<Shopkeeper>Yeah, could you go upstairs for a bit? There are
preparations there.
\N<Segi>...?

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, I'll talk about the specifics later. So I'm counting
on you, okay?

\N<Shopkeeper>Let's forget about the troublesome stuff for now. Like I
said before, I can compensate for your hard work, and in the
way you desire most... right?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Shopkeeper>Well, that's how it is. As usual, I've prepared a change of
clothes upstairs, so I'm counting on you, okay?

\N<Shopkeeper>Whether they're from Luda or not, a customer is a customer.
As long as I get paid, I'll provide the appropriate
hospitality.

\N<Shopkeeper>There's no point in being stubborn about it, after all, I've
got to make a living too.
